title: 2017 Horizon League Men's Soccer Tournament
text:
The 2017 Horizon League Men's Soccer Tournament was the 30th edition of the <a href="Horizon%20League%20Men%27s%20Soccer%20Tournament">competition</a>. The tournament determined the year's <a href="Horizon%20League">Horizon League</a> men's <a href="college%20soccer">college soccer</a> champion, as well as the conference's automatic berth in the <a href="2017%20NCAA%20Division%20I%20Men%27s%20Soccer%20Tournament">2017 NCAA Division I Men's Soccer Tournament</a>, which determines the national champion of college soccer for the season. 
Two-time defending tournament champions, the <a href="UIC%20Flames%20men%27s%20soccer">UIC Flames</a>, won their third-consecutive Horizon League title, and their sixth overall, defeating the regular season champions, <a href="Green%20Bay%20Phoenix%20men%27s%20soccer">Green Bay Phoenix</a> in the final. UIC earned a berth into the NCAA Tournament, where they lost in the first round of the tournament, 1-4 to the <a href="2017%20Wisconsin%20Badgers%20men%27s%20soccer%20team">Wisconsin Badgers</a>. No other teams in the conference earned an at-large berth into the tournament. 
Background.
Six teams participated in the tournament, and they were seeded based on their regular season conference record, or matches against other college soccer programs also in the conference.
